title: Bad Bunny declares 'ICE out' as he wins Grammy
desc: The Puerto Rican star gets political, as he's tipped to win the main prize, album of the year.

title: India's snakebite crisis is killing tens of thousands every year
desc: A new report has found that 99% of healthcare workers in India face challenges administering antivenom.

title: MOFA, Ghana AIDS Commission expand HIV training for agriculture extension officers
desc: The Ministry of Food and Agriculture (MoFA) in collaboration with the Ghana AIDS Commission, has organised a Training of Trainers workshop on HIV...

title: Conservatives celebrate anniversary of Harper’s first win while contemplating the party’s future
desc: When Mr. Harper first led the Conservatives to victory, Canada’s political landscape was markedly different

title: Liam Conejo Ramos returns to Minnesota after being detained by ICE on way home from preschool
desc: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, whose detention by federal agents as he returned from preschool sparked outrage across the United States, has been released from immigration detention, according to a US congressman.

title: Trump to close Kennedy Center arts complex for two years
desc: US President Donald Trump announced that he is closing the Kennedy Center arts complex in Washington for two years, beginning on 4 July - the nation's 250th anniversary - for a thorough renovation.

title: Asian Stocks Decline as Gold and Silver Whipsaw: Markets Wrap
desc: (Bloomberg) -- Stocks declined and precious metals gyrated in volatile trading, reflecting fragile market sentiment after a choppy end to last week on Wall Street.

title: Rosé, Bruno Mars Open Grammys With Energetic 'APT.' Performance
desc: Rosé and Bruno Mars brought the "apateu" to the Grammys with an electric performance to kickoff the show.

title: Government announces new school assessment, reporting tools
desc: Prime Minister Christopher Luxon and Education Minister Erica Stanford will speak publicly this afternoon about assessment and reporting changes for students...

title: Gold plunge deepens as traders unwind ‘crowded’ bets on rally
desc: Gold extended losses, after its biggest plunge in more than a decade on Friday, while silver’s year-to-date gains were wiped out as a record-breaking precious-metals rally unwound at breakneck speed.
